title: Ethereum Now Deflationary for 2 Months Straight - Blockworks
summary:
Sure, here's a summary of the article in less than 256 tokens:

Ethereum has been in deflationary mode for two months straight, with a surge in on-chain activity on protocols like Uniswap and Blur driving the trend. The upgrade to EIP-1559 in August 2021 led to transaction fees being burned instead of going to miners, contributing to the deflationary nature of the network. Uniswap and Blur have been the main drivers of increased on-chain activity, with a total of 18,291 ETH ($35 million) burned in the past 30 days. The recent depegging of USDC and the collapse of financial institutions have prompted crypto industry participants to advocate for decentralized financial infrastructure, which could benefit Ethereum.

title: Over $1 billion of ether has been lost forever due to bugs and human error - The Block
summary: Over $1 billion in ether has been lost due to bugs and human error, according to research by Coinbase's Conor Grogan. He cataloged 636,000 ETH ($1.15 billion) that is lost, representing 0.5% of the coin's circulating supply. The majority is due to a 2017 bug in the Parity crypto wallet, and the remaining losses are due to typos, user errors, and failed contracts. The estimate may understate the actual amount lost, as many wallets' access has been lost but cannot be determined from blockchain data alone.

title: What Is Arbitrum? Speeding Up Ethereum Using Optimistic Rollups - Decrypt
summary: Arbitrum is a scaling solution for the Ethereum blockchain that uses optimistic rollups to speed up transactions. It relays transaction information back to the main Ethereum blockchain, increasing its transaction capacity to 40,000 TPS compared to Ethereum's 14 TPS. Arbitrum also supports the Ethereum Virtual Machine (EVM), making it easy for Ethereum DeFi developers to integrate their decentralized applications (dapps) with Arbitrum without modifications. The platform is transitioning to a decentralized autonomous organization (DAO) and plans to airdrop its new ARB token to allow holders to vote in decisions related to the protocol. Arbitrum does not have a token, as all transactions on the sidechain are settled with ETH, the native cryptocurrency of the Ethereum blockchain. The project has been integrated into several decentralized finance protocols and has over $2 billion worth of cryptocurrency locked up in its smart contracts. Users can access Arbitrum through a decentralized application or directly on the token bridge, and will need to pay an Ethereum gas fee for deposits.

title: ETH Eyes $2,000 as US Investors Step Up But There’s a Critical Obstacle (Ethereum Price Analysis) - CryptoPotato
summary:
Sure, here is a summary of the article in less than 256 tokens:

Ethereum (ETH) is showing a bullish signal with key resistance levels broken to the upside. The price could target values above $2000, including $2300, in the coming weeks if the breakout is valid. However, a fake breakout could lead to a pullback towards the 50-day or 200-day moving averages or the $1300 support area. American investors' behavior is also positive, with a spike in the Coinbase premium gap chart indicating higher buying pressure in the U.S.

title: 636,000 Ethereum (ETH) Worth $1.1B Lost Forever - The Crypto Basic
summary: Coinbase Director Conor Grogan revealed on Twitter that up to 636,000 Ethereum (ETH) worth $1.15B+ has been lost forever due to typos, user errors, and buggy contracts. This accounts for 0.5% of the total circulating supply. Grogan also listed some of the biggest losses, including the Web3 foundation's $538M loss due to the Parity Multisig bug and Quadriga's $108M loss to a faulty contract. Additionally, 66,000 ETH has been burned from the supply, transforming Ethereum into a deflationary asset. ETH currently trades at $1,810.33 with a 24-hour trading volume of $10.6B.

title: Ethereum-Based Carbon Tracker Carbonable Raises $1.2M to Tackle Greenwashing - CoinDesk
summary: Carbonable, an Ethereum-based carbon tracker, has raised $1.2M to combat greenwashing in the crypto industry. The funding will be used to develop the platform and expand its capabilities. Carbonable aims to provide transparency and accountability in the carbon footprint of blockchain and Web3 projects. Learn more at consensus.coindesk.com.

title: Ethereum (ETH) Still Has Room To Run Higher, According to Crypto Analytics Firm Santiment – Here’s Why - The Daily Hodl
summary:
Sure, here's a summary of the article in less than 256 tokens:

Ethereum (ETH) has potential to reach $2,000, according to crypto analytics firm Santiment. Despite a recent price jump, Ethereum's transaction fees are still low, indicating room for growth. A Twitter survey conducted by Santiment shows more people believe Ethereum will rise above $2,000 than fall below $1,600. Meanwhile, Bitcoin's (BTC) rally in March is seen as legitimate, possibly due to the collapse of a major US bank.

title: Raoul Pal's Prediction For Ethereum 2023: “Upcoming Breakout Shall Leave Bitcoin Behind!” - Coinpedia Fintech News
summary: Raoul Pal, CEO of Real Vision, predicts that Ethereum (ETH) will outperform Bitcoin (BTC) in the upcoming cycle due to its technical and fundamental advantages. According to Pal, the ETH/BTC chart is forming a wedge and a breakout could lead to a surge that puts Bitcoin in second place. He notes that ETH/BTC needs to overcome resistance at 0.077 BTC ($2,115) to verify the breakout. This prediction is similar to one made in 2021, which argued that Ethereum's programmable blockchain and ability to trade other digital assets give it an edge over Bitcoin. However, it's important to note that these are just predictions and Bitcoin remains the top dog among cryptocurrencies.

title: Analyst Known for Calling Crypto Bottoms Predicts Breakout for Ethereum, Says Solana Primed for New Rallies - The Daily Hodl
summary:
Sure, here is a summary of the article in less than 256 tokens:

Popular crypto analyst Smart Contracter predicts a breakout for Ethereum (ETH) based on an Elliott Wave theory chart. He believes ETH could reach $1,900 in short order. Smart Contracter also thinks Bitcoin's recent rally could mean either that it's still a risk-on asset or that it's decoupled from trad finance and becoming a safe haven asset. Additionally, he suggests that Ethereum competitor Solana (SOL) could rally against Bitcoin (SOL/BTC) after taking out its diagonal resistance on the hourly chart.

title: Ethereum jumps while bitcoin maintains its pace - crypto.news
summary: Ethereum (ETH) has surged to $1,820, while bitcoin (BTC) maintains its pace. ETH's value against bitcoin decreased, but then recovered. The Ethereum token supply has decreased by $122 million, and the token is in deflation. Bitcoin has been the primary crypto asset for market speculators, but the ongoing government intervention might end the banking crisis, improving market sentiment. Significant banks have recovered after government intervention, and the banking crisis might be ending.

title: Euler Finance receives message from hacker via Ethereum, but no clarity yet - AMBCrypto News
summary: Euler Finance, a DeFi platform, was hacked and $200 million was stolen. The hacker sent a message to Euler's Ethereum address, offering to return 10% of the stolen funds in exchange for 10% of the total. When the hacker did not follow through, Euler offered a $1 million reward for information leading to the hacker's arrest and the return of the stolen funds. The hacker then transferred some of the stolen funds to a mixing service, and it is unclear if the hacker is acting alone or if there are multiple people involved. The language used in the hacker's message suggests that there may be more than one person involved. Additionally, Chainalysis has linked the wallet address to North Korea, leading some to speculate that the hack may be an intentional attempt to mislead investigators.

title: Ethereum [ETH]: Investors return to L2 bridges; zKSync, StarkNet addresses swell - AMBCrypto News
summary: Investors are returning to layer 2 (L2) bridges on the Ethereum blockchain, with addresses on zkSync and StarkNet increasing their interaction with projects despite the lack of token confirmation. zkSync saw a significant increase in token swaps and ETH bridges last week, with over 39,000 addresses bridging $871 million. StarkNet has had several integrations in March, including an explorer launch on zkEVM and a collaboration with Horizon Land to build a decentralized metaverse platform. The StarkNet Foundation has also announced the formation of a committee to distribute tokens to its users, with the aim of ensuring a fair, decentralized, and transparent distribution. However, airdrops are not a guarantee of asset performance, and other factors like use cases, adoption, and fundamentals also play a role.

title: Vitalik Buterin is Not Leaving Ethereum - CoinJournal
summary: Vitalik Buterin, creator of Ethereum, is not leaving the project despite talk of fading into the background. He believes that for Ethereum to be successful in the long term, it must be able to survive without his direct oversight. Buterin has hired people with expertise in areas he doesn't specialize in and recognizes that algorithms and smart contracts are taking on more responsibilities. He will continue to contribute to Ethereum through blog posts, research, and Github commits, but has no plans to reduce his involvement.

title: Despite ETC hashrate facing 2023 lows, here’s why day traders remain bullish - AMBCrypto News
summary: Despite a drop in Ethereum Classic's (ETC) hashrate to its lowest level this year, day traders remain bullish on the asset. The network's hashrate and difficulty have decreased, suggesting a potential lack of interest or profitability for miners. However, ETC holders have seen increased buying pressure, with the asset's price trading close to the upper band of the Bollinger Band indicator. The Relative Strength Index (RSI) and Money Flow Index (MFI) are both up, indicating strong buying pressure. Additionally, the On-balance volume (OBV) is in an uptrend, suggesting that buyers are more active in the market than sellers. The Directional Movement Index (DMI) confirms increased buyer presence, with the buyers' strength solidly above the sellers' strength.

title: Is Big Eyes Coin (BIG) Considered an Ethereum Cryptocurrency or a Solana Cryptocurrency? - Analytics Insight
summary: Big Eyes Coin (BIG) is an Ethereum-based cryptocurrency that operates on the Ethereum blockchain and uses the ERC-20 standard for exchanges. Despite its meme coin status, Big Eyes Coin (BIG) is expected to surpass its competitors like Dogecoin (DOGE) and Shiba Inu (SHIB) due to its feature-packed design and compatibility with the largest DeFi market on the Ethereum blockchain. However, Solana cryptocurrency offers high-speed and low-cost transactions, which could potentially make it a more attractive option for some users. Ultimately, the choice between Ethereum and Solana depends on the individual user's needs and preferences.

title: EVE Online Creator CCP Raises $40M to Create Web3 EVE Game - Decrypt
summary: CCP Games, the developer of EVE Online, has raised $40 million to create a new Web3 game set within the EVE universe. The new game will feature on-chain systems and an emphasis on player agency and autonomy, allowing for new ways of player engagement. This is CCP's first move into Web3 gaming, but the company has been interested in the potential of blockchain to revolutionize the gaming industry for some time. Other major traditional game makers, such as Ubisoft and Square Enix, have also been experimenting and investing in the Web3 space.

title: What's the Latest Update on Dogetti, Ethereum, and Avalanche Before You Buy Them? - Analytics Insight
summary:
Sure, here's a summary of the article in less than 256 tokens:

Dogetti is a new meme coin that aims to create a close-knit community of users through its DAO. It rewards users with 2% of all transactions and has a maximum token supply of 100 billion. Ethereum is the second-largest cryptocurrency in the world, known for its ability to host decentralized applications. However, its main utility has become its major problem, as more projects have made it slower and more expensive. Avalanche is a blockchain that can replace Ethereum by hosting decentralized applications faster and more scalably.

title: Ethereum worth more than Turkish lira and Norwegian krone - CoinJournal
summary: Ethereum's market value has increased by 35% in the past two weeks, placing it 27th on Coinmarketcap's list of cryptocurrencies. It has gained ground against the Polish zloty, Norwegian krone, and Turkish lira, with its value now surpassing these fiat currencies. The Russian ruble has also seen a significant increase in market value, closing in on Bitcoin. The total market capitalization of cryptocurrencies has surpassed $2 trillion, with Bitcoin accounting for $900 billion and Ethereum $400 billion.

title: Ethereum: increase the staking crypto on Lido - The Cryptonomist
summary: Ethereum's staking on Lido has seen significant growth, with the market capitalization of staked Ether (STETH) reaching $10.36 billion. STETH is now the eighth largest cryptocurrency by market capitalization, according to Coingecko data. Lido is the largest decentralized finance (DeFi) protocol, with a total value locked (TVL) of $49.01 billion, accounting for 21.59% of the entire DeFi TVL. The DAO behind Lido is considering whether to sell or stake its $30 million in Ether from its treasury, with options including staking on Lido or selling for stablecoins.

title: OKX Founder Unveils The Future Of OKBChain: A Promising Layer 2 Ethereum Sidechain - TronWeekly
summary: OKX founder unveils future of OKBChain, a layer 2 Ethereum sidechain with promising technology. OKTChain will remain an L1 chain, supporting WASM virtual machines, while OKBChain will be an L2 chain starting from side chain technology and developing to ZK technology. Both chains are part of OKX's core product offerings. OKX is also launching its testnet soon without delay.

title: Lido Finance Staking Review 2024 - Lido Is Legit BUT Pay Attention To This - Captain Altcoin
summary: Lido Finance is a decentralized liquid staking protocol that allows users to stake Ethereum, Solana, Polygon, Polkadot, and Kusama and earn rewards in real-time. The platform offers a user-friendly interface, maximized earning potential through daily staking rewards and DeFi activities, a native token (LDO), quality audits by reputable firms, and supports popular DeFi wallets like TrustWallet and MetaMask. Lido charges a 10% fee on staking rewards, which is split between the node operators and the protocol’s treasury. The platform is considered safe and trustworthy, with billions of dollars in staked assets. However, there are risks involved, such as potential smart contract vulnerabilities, derivative token stETH losing its peg to the native token, and DAO key management risks. Lido is best suited for users who are looking to stake assets and use them as collateral at the same time, with the purpose of increasing earnings. The platform is also good for staking ETH, and some of the best wallets for staking assets are Led
